chunks.original_text: 上清太上八素真经 经名：上清太上八素真经。 撰人不详，约出朴东晋南朝。 系早期上清派重要经典之一。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部玉诀类。 上清太上八素真经 《太上隐书八素真经》者，乃玄清玉皇之道也。 上皇天帝以此书授太微天帝君、三元紫精道君、真阳元老君。 此君受书，施行道成后，以付太上道君。 太上道君以传金阙后圣李君，李君以付太虚真人、南岳赤君，使下授学道，宿有金名玉字，高阁刻名，当为真人者。 太上之隐文，不传於地仙，地仙亦自不得获之矣。 太上曰：夫五星者，是日月之灵根，天胎之五藏也。 是以天精结缠，以成五星，天地赖以综气，日月击之而明。 若夫天气不育，则三合亏盈，地气不育，则万物枯滞，亏盈则天震地动。 若夫列宿不守，则日月薄蚀，五星乱度，则二象失光。 天地泰则五星映清，天精合则五星光明。 星之灵道，太山上应，德神玉清，上照太虚，下朗万兆。 兆有得失，则五度错逆，兆有和吉，则流行顺道，映洞祸福，毫缕毕彰，玄照纤末，幽存功过者也。 五帝上言於星中真皇，真皇上奏於太上玉君，是以辰光转烛以示万生，傍行越位以告灾祥也。 地建五岳之山，以象五行之星； 人立五脏之神，以拟五行之用。 三气回合，是以天地列备矣。 星之为精，上通众精，下共光津，吐纳则三华漱泽万灵，傍达三六，中含养生，其事洞而微极，其器浩而长揽也。 仙人唯知飞丹召霜，煎炼云朱水玉，解金九炉炎霄，勤苦极於营赡，司候足於劬劳，就有成者，不过升身上天，超跃玄洲耳。 此故仙人而已，远可游於九宫之间矣，则未有得真人之门户也。 吾今有一道，乃为上真之法，不但中真而已。 子乃欲招致五星，与同辇驾三素以上腾，坐八景以游盼，登太帝之西墉，纵形太空，白日登晨乎。 吾昔受之於玉皇，行之迄今，四十六万年而不休者，玩此道之奇妙，乐五星之接遇也。 既得分形亿兆，生云育泽，上游玉清，下看太极矣，遂为太上之真人者，致五星之精也。 隐秘妙术，藏之云阁，蕴抱灵诀，与之俱游者矣。 子当下封万生，为十天之帝，玄名碧书，早刻琼阁，宜令初学真人，受此秘章，令子传付施行，必当得人。 此书是上真之诀，不得传地仙之夫也。 出传之始，皆当须玄应感悟，灵告其人，乃当清斋委约，誓盟三天，七百年中得三传，限尽藏之五岳，不复得出也。 泄漏天文隐书，已告天帝，诛其三祖，又下三官，绝其身命，生被水火，死为下鬼矣。 诸学真之人而受此书，皆有太帝目名西华宫，有琅简蕊书於紫宫，当为真人者，乃得此文也。 乃是子未生之前五千岁，已有玄名定录，当遇此经也。 子勿以始受此书，而谓非宿命之分矣。 玉皇下盼游生，见有得此书者，即告太上，使遣飞灵玉童三十六人，侍此书之所在处也。 又告太极遣南陵玉女三十二人，卫此五星真君、君夫人之名字也。 又并使玉童、玉女，卫护有书之身。 有书皆盛以别笈，开发省按，皆向书再拜，烧香左右。 玉童、玉女司视功过，察人诚向，有　违有善，径闻太上，不可不慎。 修行此道，五年之中，玉童、玉女见形，为子使役。 行之十四年，道成，得与五星同舆，上诣玉清宫。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Eight Primes of the Grand Supreme**

*The Scripture of the Eight Primes of the Hidden Writ of the Grand Supreme* is the Dao of the Jade Emperor of Mystic Clarity. The August Emperor of the Upper Heaven bestowed this scripture upon the Emperor Lord of the Grand Tenuity, the Three Origins Purple Essence Dao Lord, and the True Yang Primordial Elder Lord. After these lords received the scripture and practiced the Dao to perfection, they transmitted it to the Grand Supreme Dao Lord. The Grand Supreme Dao Lord passed it to the Posterior Sage Li Lord of the Golden Watchtower, who then entrusted it to the Great Void Perfected and the Red Lord of the Southern Marchmount, instructing them to transmit it below to those who study the Dao—those whose names are inscribed in gold and jade upon the lofty towers and are destined to become Perfected.

The hidden writ of the Grand Supreme is not transmitted to earthbound immortals, nor can such immortals ever obtain it.

The Grand Supreme said: The Five Stars are the spiritual roots of the sun and moon, the five viscera of the celestial embryo. Thus, the essence of heaven coalesces and entwines to form the Five Stars, upon which heaven and earth rely to harmonize qi, and by which the sun and moon are struck to shine. If the qi of heaven fails to nurture, the Three Conjunctions wane and wax; if the qi of earth fails to nurture, the myriad beings wither and stagnate. Waxing and waning cause heaven to quake and earth to tremble. If the constellations do not hold their positions, the sun and moon suffer eclipse; if the Five Stars disorder their courses, the Two Images lose their light. When heaven and earth are in harmony, the Five Stars gleam with clarity; when the essence of heaven converges, the Five Stars radiate brilliance.

The numinous Dao of the stars corresponds above to Mount Tai, while their virtue and spirit ascend to Jade Clarity, illuminating the Great Void above and illuminating the myriad multitudes below. When the multitudes falter or prosper, the Five Movements err and reverse; when the multitudes are harmonious and auspicious, the celestial currents flow in accord with the Dao, casting light upon fortune and misfortune so that even the finest threads are revealed. The mysterious illumination extends to the most minute details, discerning hidden merits and transgressions.

The Five Thearchs declared this within the Stellar Perfected Sovereign, who then memorialized it to the Jade Lord of the Grand Supreme. Thus, the radiance of the stars revolves like a torch to manifest before the myriad beings, and their errant courses and displaced positions foretell calamity and fortune.

Earth establishes the Five Marchmounts to emulate the Five Phases of the stars; humans establish the spirits of the five viscera to correspond to the functions of the Five Phases. When the Three Qi revolve and converge, heaven and earth array themselves in perfect order.

The essence of the stars communicates above with all essences and below with the luminous fluids. In their exhalation and inhalation, the Three Flowers bathe the myriad spirits in effulgence, extending to the Three and Six, and inwardly nurturing life. Their affairs are profound and subtly boundless; their influence is vast and enduring.

Immortals know only how to fly elixirs and summon frost, to refine cinnabar and distill cloud-rosin and jade-water, to dissolve gold and kindle the nine furnaces to soar in the empyrean. Their toil and suffering are extreme in their pursuits, and their vigilance and labor are exhaustive. Even if they succeed, they ascend bodily to heaven and transcend the Mystic Continent—nothing more. This is merely the way of immortals, who may wander among the Nine Palaces but have not yet entered the gate of the Perfected.

I now possess a Dao that is the method of the Supreme Perfected, surpassing even the Median Perfected. You may summon the Five Stars to share your chariot, ascending with the Three Primes, sitting upon the Eight Effulgences to gaze about, and mounting the Western Wall of the Grand Thearch. You may roam the Great Void, ascending at dawn in broad daylight.

I received this from the Jade Emperor in former times and have practiced it without ceasing for 460,000 years, delighting in the marvels of this Dao and the companionship of the Five Stars. Having attained the power to multiply my form into countless manifestations, to generate clouds and nurture effluence, to roam above in Jade Clarity and gaze below upon the Great Ultimate, I became a Perfected of the Grand Supreme by attaining the essence of the Five Stars.

This arcane and wondrous art is concealed within the cloud pavilions, its numinous instructions embraced as I wander with them. You shall govern the myriad beings as an emperor of the Ten Heavens, your name inscribed in azure upon the jade towers. It is fitting that beginning Perfected receive this secret writ, that you transmit and practice it, and that you find the right person to receive it. This scripture is the secret of the Supreme Perfected and must not be transmitted to earthbound immortals.

At the outset of its transmission, one must await a mysterious resonance and spiritual revelation, whereupon the recipient shall purify themselves, fast, and swear oaths to the Three Heavens. Within seven hundred years, it may be transmitted three times; thereafter, it shall be sealed within the Five Marchmounts and never again brought forth. To divulge the hidden writ of celestial patterns is to invite the judgment of the Heavenly Emperor, who will punish three generations of one’s ancestors, while the Three Officials will sever one’s lifespan. In life, one shall suffer water and fire; in death, one shall become a lowly ghost.

All who study the Perfected and receive this scripture shall have their names recorded by the Grand Emperor in the Western Flower Palace, inscribed upon jade tablets in the Purple Palace. Only those destined to become Perfected may obtain this text. Indeed, five thousand years before your birth, your name was already determined in the mysterious records, and you were fated to encounter this scripture. Do not suppose that receiving this text now is not your predestined portion.

When the Jade Emperor gazes down upon the living and sees one who has obtained this scripture, he informs the Grand Supreme, who dispatches thirty-six Flying Numinous Jade Lads to attend the scripture’s abode. He also commands the Great Ultimate to send thirty-two Jade Maidens of the Southern Mound to guard the names of the Five Star Perfected Lords and their consorts. Moreover, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens shall protect the person who possesses the scripture.

The scripture is to be kept in a separate case. When opening, perusing, or consulting it, one must face the text, bow twice, and burn incense to either side. The Jade Lads and Jade Maidens observe one’s merits and transgressions, scrutinizing one’s sincerity and devotion. Any transgression or virtue is promptly reported to the Grand Supreme—one must be vigilant.

By cultivating this Dao for five years, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens will manifest and serve you. After fourteen years of practice, the Dao will be perfected, and you shall ride with the Five Stars to ascend to the Jade Clarity Palace.

chunks.original_text: 夫上真之道有七，太上之道有三，中真之道有六，下真之道有八。 上真之道有七，列篇目于左： 第一曰太上郁仪奔日文，第二曰太上结璘奔月章，第三曰太上八素奔辰隐书，第四曰太微帝君飞天纲上经，第五曰高上大洞真经三十九章，第六曰金阙灵书紫文上经，第七曰黄老八道九真中经。 右上真之道，总而行之，为上清真人，给玉童、玉女各三千人，位为诸天帝之位。 行则三色之节，从群神万真，前导凤歌，后从玄钧，白虎启路，飞龙翼辕。 太上之道有三，列篇目于左： 玉清隐书，神虎大符，金虎真符。 右太上之道，总而行之，为太上之道，给玉童、玉女各二千人，位为上真玉皇之君。 行则五色神节，从千真群仙，前导天钧，后从鸾歌，三真侍辕，腾翥九天。 中真之道有六，列篇目于左：太丹隐书朝真上经玉帝神符，三天正法凤真之文九真升玄文，三元布经四真之章太上金策，方诸洞房玉字上经六甲灵飞，灵宝秘文三皇内文天文大字，青要紫书曲素诀辞三五顺行。 右中真之道，总而行之，则为上清中道真人，给玉童、玉女各一千人，位为上清左右卿相之师。 行则紫毛之节，从万神千真，前吹凤呜，后奏天钧，玄龙启道，五帝验轩，飞行太空，遨戏丹霄。 下真之道有八，列篇目于左： 上清九化十变三九素语，丹景道精隐地八术，天关三图玄皇玉书，神州七变七转洞经，紫度中方石精玉马之母，绛录黄道玉目龙书众文，素奏中章五行秘符，五帝玉玄上元五书。 右下真之道，总而行之，则为上清下元真人，给玉童玉女五百人，位为上清左右大夫之官。 行则五色之节，从众神玉女，前啸九凤，后吹八鸾，白虬启道，太极验轩，飞行倒景，遨游紫房。 上清上真、中道真人、下元真人，所应施修道经，各有篇目，分别为部第，令相随也。 若总修一真之事者，当尽得一真之部书，兼而行之，则为上清真人。 若所得书不备具，或得上经，或得中篇，或得下文，虽专修行而阙其余者，但可飞仙而已。 远诣太极，下游五岳，自不得为上清三真也。 子当勤心天地，启告神玄，远游名山，祝愿千灵，寻求宝文，令道德备焉。 既修行一部，上登上清，所给玉童、玉女，便有千数百矣。 若偏得一书，而不都具，则玉童、玉女，故自依所受书限，而给卫之耳。 唯修《太上郁仪奔日文》、《结璘奔月章》、《八素奔辰隐书》，便登上清为下元真人，以不尽修上真之事故也。 过其余者，皆应兼修，兼修道成，乃升上清。 若都总修三真之道经，闻见玉清之隐书，佩神虎之大符，便上为玉皇之君太上之真，给玉童、玉女三万人，遨游高上之阙，出入玉清之宫，於是天帝太微君，来受事於玉皇焉。 《玉清隐书》有四卷，乃高上玉皇昔受之於玉玄太皇道君禁书也。 玉皇君所宝妙者也，以付太极四真人，使掌秘藏之，五千年内听三授，授於上清之玉真人也。 若一千年中过三人，亦听之也。 授限讫，不得复传。 世俗之中，千万之人，时有一人当为天真所授，以得此书者，太上玄台已有玉名，当为上真故也。 有书者在家给玉童三百人，玉女三百人，旦夕当致众真仙神、名山之灵，诣其寝房，论道讲德矣。 此谓有书者在家处俗，未去学道时也。

chunks.original_text: 山寻真，研味灵文，则威制六天，役使山神，五岳来朝，玉童玉女形见，侍真烧香。 《太上神虎符》，太上虚皇道君以授於太上也。 太上道君以付三天真皇，使授诸真人及天帝众官也。 此符有真名於上清者，皆受佩之也。 但有此符而无《玉清隐书》者，皆不得为上清之真，但太极之上真耳。 《太微天帝金虎符》，太上玉真保皇道君以授於太上太微天帝君也。 天帝有三十六，其太微天帝最尊贵，诸天帝皆诣受事矣。 受此符皆威制万神，使役千灵，龙虎卫从，得乘三素之云，上升太极上清，拜为左公。 《玉清隐书》玄远绝邈，下真及飞仙之徒，便当息心於无穷之冀耳。 《神虎符》、《金虎符》，飞仙辈勤求不已，或有得理矣。 自无玄名灵箓，复求不与此文相遇者，比肩也、况玉清之道乎。 太上曰：昔谓太清不可登，而况於太极乎。 乃谓上清不可闻，而况於玉清乎。 明真中有高卑，玄中有阶次也。 过此以前，非所复议。 玉清宫之下真人，乃上清宫之上真人。 太极宫之上真人，乃上清宫之下真人。 太清宫之上真人，乃太极宫之下真人。 从此以下，次得九宫之飞仙也。 《玉清隐书》当传之时，太极四真人各奉执一卷，以上呈上皇、高上、玉皇、玉玄四道君，探按金格玉名，当为上真玉君者，然后乃出传之耳。 有此者立致众真仙人，来诣其房寝，若修至道，太上不复试其情状也。 是宿有金格玉名，必当为上真故也。 《玉清隐书》，道妙於《郁仪文》矣。 有《太上郁仪奔日文》、《结璘奔月章》、《八素奔辰经》，修行其法，太极真人不复下试。 有《大洞真经》者，修行其法，七祖、父母皆离脱鬼名，原贷三官考谪，度录仙府，解释艰罗，使诣朱火丹陵宫，受学仙道。 仙道成，使翼佐五帝，为九宫之仙也。 谓其人备《大洞真经》者也。 此书依四极定法，偏为其七祖获仙，不同於他经矣，甚不可不修行也。 若既修之而被试，不过或偏行一道，或中路而息者，自救不暇，亦不能为其七世致仙也。 夫鬼可以学仙，如人可以学道，七世立德，故庆流子孙，令致神仙也。 一身修道，备明洞经者，则祚及七祖，故当反此胎形，以为仙官耳。 中央黄老君以此洞经之妙，而为七世获福，尤深秘之，与《郁仪文》 同笈。 上清众真亦贵此道，以其功加於七祖，德升於上世故也。 后圣李君奉受《八素真经奔辰隐书》，施行其法，乃致太微天帝下迎，五星同舆，乘华三素，上登玉清，受书为上清金阙帝君。 登飞木星之道：岁星圆镜木精，玄朗东阳之陔，星中有九门，门中出九锋芒，锋芒光垂九百万丈，一门辄有一青帝，备门奉卫於中央青皇真君也。 中央有始阳上真青皇道君，讳澄澜，字清凝； 夫人讳宝容，字飞云，治在木星之内，镇守九门，运青光流锋，以照上下之真。 欲飞登之法，常思见岁星，当' 正心视星，以右手拊心而礼之，左手掩两目，乃九闭气，又叩齿二十七通，咽液九过，使目闭於手下，心呼岁星中真皇之君、君夫人名讳字三过，毕曰：愿得与始阳青皇真君、君夫人，共乘八景碧舆，上登太上宫。 言毕，乃临闭目於手下，向星微祝曰： 天地交和，精流东方，仰望九门，飞霞散锋，始阳碧台，中有青皇，青牙垂晖，映照九方，郁察夫人，字曰飞云，齐服灵锦，龙帔虎裙，腰带凤符，首巾华冠，出无入虚，遨游太元，前策青帝，后从千神，来见迎接，得为飞真，上登玉清，高上之房。

Seeking the Perfected amidst the mountains and savoring the numinous scriptures, one may command the Six Heavens, dispatch the mountain spirits, and summon the Five Peaks to pay homage. Jade Lads and Jade Maidens will manifest in form, attending the Perfected to burn incense.

The *Divine Tiger Talisman of the Supreme* was bestowed by the Supreme Void Sovereign Dao Lord upon the Supreme. The Supreme Dao Lord then transmitted it to the Three Heavens’ Perfected August Ones, who in turn granted it to the various Perfected and the celestial officials of the Heavenly Thearchs. All those whose true names are recorded in the Upper Clarity and who receive this talisman may wear it. Yet those who possess only this talisman but lack the *Hidden Book of Jade Clarity* may not become Perfected of Upper Clarity, but only Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate.

The *Golden Tiger Talisman of the Heavenly Thearch of Grand Tenuity* was conferred by the Supreme Jade Perfected Preserver August Dao Lord upon the Supreme Heavenly Thearch of Grand Tenuity. Among the thirty-six Heavenly Thearchs, the Heavenly Thearch of Grand Tenuity is the most exalted, and all the Heavenly Thearchs come to receive his commands. Those who receive this talisman command the myriad spirits, dispatch the thousand numina, and are attended by dragon and tiger escorts. They may ride the Threefold Plainness clouds to ascend to the Supreme Ultimate and Upper Clarity, where they are appointed as Left Dukes.

The *Hidden Book of Jade Clarity* is profoundly distant and utterly transcendent. Even the Lesser Perfected and the ranks of flying immortals must rest their aspirations upon this boundless hope. The *Divine Tiger Talisman* and the *Golden Tiger Talisman* are ceaselessly sought by the flying immortals, and some may indeed attain them. Yet without one’s name inscribed in the numinous registers, even if one were to seek without respite, one would never encounter these texts—how much less the Dao of Jade Clarity?

The Supreme has said: "In ancient times, it was said that the Grand Clarity could not be ascended—how much less the Supreme Ultimate? It was said that Upper Clarity could not be heard of—how much less Jade Clarity?" chunks.original_text: 祝毕，去手，临目对星，服星之光二十七吞，存视星九芒，使尽来入喉中也。 都毕，又叩齿三通。 常行之十四年，木星中青皇大君，奏闻高上玉清宫，刻太微蕊简，定名玉书，位为上清上飞真人。 木星有九门，门内有九青帝，其一帝辄备一门，以奉承於中央青皇上真大君也。 青皇者，东方之上真，始精之尊神也，出入玉清，与高上为友也。 其门内青帝，或号青灵之公，或号青神，或号青精，或号青帝之君，并受事於中央青皇也。 行八素之秘道，则致青皇来降。 已行五灵之外法者，则致青神来授书。 是故道有深浅，致有尊卑。 天无星之时，天阴之夕，可於寝室中向东存修而祝也。 天道微妙，玄纲毫分，不必对星而行之也。 有星时可出庭中，坐立适意。 所谓上真之道，登东辰之法，不传地仙辈也。 飞登火星之道：火星玄镜丹精，映观南轩，星有三门，门中出三锋芒，光垂三百万文，一门内辄有一赤帝，凡三赤帝，备门奉卫於南真上皇真君。 星中央有丹火朱阳赤皇上道真君，讳维渟，字散融； 夫人讳华瓶，字玄罗，治在火星内，镇守三门，运赤光飞云，以朗天下之真人也。 欲飞登之法，思见荧惑星，正心视星，以左手拊心而礼之，右手掩口，乃三闭气，又叩齿二十七通，咽液九过，临闭两目，心呼荧惑真皇君、荧惑夫人讳字三过，毕曰：愿得与丹火赤皇君、君夫人，共乘八景丹舆，上登玉清宫。 毕，乃向星微祝曰： 玄象流映，丹光南冥，仰望三门，朱云绛城，中有丹皇，名曰维渟，夫人内照，是为华瓶，齐服云霜，凤华龙铃，腰带虎书，首巾飞青，出元入玄，翱翔五城，首导赤帝，后从六丁，来见招延，得真之名，上登玄虚，金书玉清。 祝毕，去手勿复掩口，故临目视星，服星之光二十七吞，存令星三芒尽来入喉中。 都毕，又叩齿三通。 常行之十四年，荧惑星中赤皇上真道君，奏闻三元玄上宫，刻玄圃琼简，定名金书，位为上清上飞真人。 荧惑星有三门，门内有三赤帝，其一帝辄备一门，以奉属於中央赤皇君也。 赤皇者，南方之上真，丹宫之贵神，出入玉清，与三元上皇为友也。 其星中赤帝君者，或号赤灵之公，或号赤神，或号赤精，或号赤帝，并受事於中央赤皇上真大君。 子行八素之隐书，则致赤皇来降。 已行五灵之外法，则致赤神来授书。 是以道有隐外，文有秘显，尔乃招真有尊卑之差，求神有上下之序。 若无星之时，天阴之夕，可於寝室南向存之。 有星可出中庭，坐立任意。 此所谓奔南辰之法，不传地仙，传之犯泄漏之罪。 地仙自复有八素经，论服王气吐纳之道也。 又有九素经，论召鬼使精行厨检魂魄之事，正陆行名山长生不死而已。 八素经后有天钧上曲阳歌九章，九素经后有凤吹龙啸阴歌八章，此是地仙之秘书也。 今所谓太上奔辰八素，行上清之道，非地仙之八素也。 地仙之啸歌，以待上清之行游耳。 飞登金星之道：太白星圆镜金精，焕耀西辰，太白星中有七门，门中有七锋芒，锋芒光垂七百万丈，一门内各有一白帝，凡有七白帝，备门奉卫於西真上皇道君。 星中央有大素少阳白皇上真道君，讳寥凌，字振寻； 夫人讳飙英，字灵恩，治在金星之内，镇守七门，运白光飞精，以映上元真人。

Perform the Sevenfold Breath-Holding, strike the teeth twenty-seven times, and swallow saliva nine times. With eyes closed, visualize the True August Lord of the Metal Star and his consort, reciting their names thrice. Conclude with the invocation:

This White August Lord is the supreme Perfected of the West, the venerable sovereign of Great Simplicity, who roams the Mysterious Clarity and befriends the Primordial August Lord of the Dao. The White Thearchs within the gates may be styled White Numinous Duke, White Spirit, White Essence, or White August Lord, all serving the Central White August Lord of the Upper Perfected.

Clad in azure mantles and purple brocade skirts, tiger talismans at their waists, lotus crowns upon their heads, they emerge to traverse the Nine Voids, entering the resounding Jade Ford. chunks.original_text: 辰星有五门，门内有五黑帝，其一帝辄备一门，以奉属於中央玄皇君也。 玄皇者，北方之上真，太玄之尊君，出入上虚，与紫精道君为友也。 其备门黑帝，或号为黑灵之公，或号黑神，或号黑精一或号黑帝君、并受事於中央太玄黑真上皇君。 行八素之隐道，则致北皇来降。 已行五灵之外法，则致黑帝君来授书。 尊卑差序，故道有隐显焉。 若天阴夕，及无星见之时，可於室中寝处常修之。 此高上之秘道，奔登北辰之法也，非地仙陆行所得闻者也么 玉清、上清、太极、太清九宫，并各有官僚，公卿、大夫、侯伯，置署如一，更相管统，奉属於上。 宫阙次第，类相似，但道有尊贵，德业有升降。 飞登土星之道：镇星圆镜土精，镇瘾黄道，镇星中有四门，门中有四锋芒，锋芒光垂四百万丈，一门各有一黄帝，凡四黄帝，备门奉卫於镇元黄真君也。 星中央有中黄真皇道君，讳藏睦，字耽延； 夫人讳空瑶，字非贤，治在镇星之内，镇鉴四门，运黄裳流气，朗映中元，照盼学真者。 欲飞登之法，思见镇星，正心视星，以两手拊心。 村心毕，举左手以掩洞房上，乃四闭气，又叩齿二十七通，咽液九过，临闭两目，心呼镇星真君、君夫人讳字三过。 毕曰：愿得与中央太皇道君、君夫人，共乘八景金舆，上登上清宫。 毕，又向星微祝曰： 四气徘徊，合注中元，仰望九极，傍观四门，黄台紫房，乘锋散芒，灵光郁散，天华落瓫，中有黄皇，厥字耽延，夫人潜德，是为非贤，理和命气，导玄灌元，齐服黄云，龙锦虎裙，腰佩金符，首巾紫冠，出凌玄空，展光金门，前导黄帝，六己卫轩，来下见迎，上登天阙，金书太上，琅简刻名，飞行太空，得为玉卿。 祝毕，去手勿复掩洞房上，故临两目，服星之光二十七遍，存令四芒尽来入喉中。 都毕，又三叩齿。 常行之十四年，镇星中黄上真皇君，奏闻太上宫，刻霄台碧简，定九玄丹文，位为上清真公，下友四极上真人。 镇星中有四门，门内有四黄帝，其一帝辄备一门，以奉属於中央黄真皇君也。 中央黄真上皇者，中极之高尊，出入太微，与皇初道君为友也。 其黄帝守门，或号曰黄灵之公，或号黄神，或号黄精，或号黄帝君，并受事於中黄上真之君也。 行八素之秘道，则致黄真道君来迎。 已行五灵之外法，则致黄帝来授书矣。 天阴无星之时，皆於寝室施行，同存五方也。 真人云：在室内存星，亦不异於见星也。 勿谓不见星，而当废之也。 此太上之隐道，登辰之秘法矣。 吞服星光芒时，当悉存星真上皇、皇夫人，乘光中来下，入口咽之，临目仿髴如有其形也。 此李君口诀。 恒修太上隐法，招存五星之上皇者，五年之中，仿髴形见。 七年都见，与之周行。 十四年，五皇一合来下，共乘玄华之舆，三素紫云，前导五帝，后从万真，五皇携之共载，白日登辰，上朝玉清，授书为上清上真人。 太上隐书五皇上真五通之日，太上秘此日，不以告九宫中仙人、真人。 唯有太玄玉书，金阁刻名者，当其遇逢，乃知其日耳。 夫五通者，天精开畅，上真吉会，群灵万仙相庆之日也。 正月六日日中、二月一日哺时、三月七日夜半、四月九日食时、五月十五日夜半、六月三日中时、七月七日夜半、八月四日中时、九月二十日平旦、十月一日平旦、十一月六日夜半、十二月十二日夜半，此十二月，五星中上皇太真道君，俱登上清、玉清，见九玄太上道君。

Moreover, the Thousand Perfected and the Thirty-Six Heavenly Emperors, descending to the Flying Immortals of the Great Clarity and above, all gather in celebration at the Supreme Ultimate’s Upper Palace. They deliberate upon the diligence or negligence of those in the world who seek the True, recording the names of those who study the True. These shall be inscribed upon the Golden Pavilion and the verdicts written upon the petal-script tablets. They assess the merits and transgressions of the seven generations of those who seek the True, determining the depth of their offenses and the severity of their punishments, thereby establishing ranks among the Perfected according to their sins.

If one’s seven generations are without fault and one’s own efforts are diligent, all shall be inscribed upon the petal-script tablets and engraved with jade characters, and one shall be appointed as a Left Perfected Lord of the Upper Clarity. If one’s seven generations bear many sins yet one’s own efforts are diligent, one shall still be ranked as a Lesser Perfected. If one’s ancestors have accumulated sins and one’s own transgressions are many, even if one’s efforts are not entirely negligent, one shall only attain the rank of a Lesser Immortal. Sins committed first cannot be erased by merit, nor can grave transgressions be absolved by diligence alone.

These Five Convergences are auspicious gatherings for the dissolution of sins and the erasure of transgressions. If you know these days, there is hope. When the Five Perfected ascend to court, it is called the Five Convergences, for their perception is far-reaching and every minute detail is illuminated. If you wish to beseech on these days for the removal of your seven ancestors’ offenses and your own past transgressions, I shall command the Three Officials to petition for the lifting of your punishments, report directly to the Heavenly Emperor to expunge your records of sin, absolve your servitude, and disperse your books of misfortune, allowing your seven generations to roam freely and joyously. You, having attained the True, shall bring blessings to your forebears—would this not be fitting?

Today, I grant you the means to prostrate yourself once and bring celebration to your seven generations—this is the essential Dao. Should you recklessly reveal that these days are the Five Convergences, your sins shall be increased fourfold, and though you repent a thousand times, it shall be of no avail.

The Perfected One seals his lips and writes in solitude, even in an open field, fearing that the slightest glance of a hundred creatures might violate the prohibition against disclosure. Can you not be deeply cautious? Can you not be deeply cautious?

Master Li says: On these days, enter a quiet chamber in seclusion, burn incense, face north, and bow five times. Silently invoke the names of the August Perfected Lords of the Five Stars and their consorts three times. Afterward, click your teeth five times, then remove your headscarf, kneel at length, and reverently address the August Perfected Lords of the Five Stars, Sun, and Moon, the Highest Perfected Lords and their consorts, the Jade Clarity’s Supreme August Lord of the Upper Clarity, and the Sagely Lord of the Great Dao before their thrones.

Thereupon, confess the myriad sins and transgressions of your seven ancestors, parents, and yourself, from past generations to the present, beseeching deliverance. Petition the Three Officials to report to the Heavenly Emperor, that your names of sin may be severed and released, your black tablets erased. Pray that you may accompany the Perfected of the Five Stars, together ascending to the Radiant Dawn, entering the Upper Clarity, and traversing the Jade Gate.

Recall the roots of your transgressions, enumerate the extent of your offenses, and confess freely, ensuring your words are sincere and exhaustive. On this day, your repentance shall ascend directly to the Supreme August One—this is the Supreme August One’s auspicious gathering, the Heavenly Immortals’ celebration of the August Highest Day. On this day, the Perfected Lords and Emperors present dragon robes, phoenix mantles, tiger belts, and flying garments to the August Highest One, for this day is treasured and grants absolution from punishment. Those who do not know these Five Convergence days shall not be included in the example of absolution.

Those who study the True must practice this constantly and conceal these days, allowing no one to know of them.

Later Sage Master Li says: On these days, contemplate auspicious matters, aspire to become a Flying Immortal, and cast aside all worries, lest your essence and soul be plunged into sorrow. Cultivate virtue, bestow kindness, relieve the destitute, perform meritorious deeds, and spread benevolence. Refrain from exercising authority or punishment—this is the Supreme August One’s auspicious day. On these days, the Supreme August One dispatches Jade Lads and Jade Maidens to secretly observe the sincerity of those who study the Dao. Even the unspoken intentions of your heart—whether good or evil—are known and shall be reported to the August Highest One. chunks.original_text: 须壬辰吉会，圣君来下，当命召五岳，出此笥书，以付上相四辅，使教上真之才也。 又书一通，以白素之纹，八色之彩，笔自而书之。 差次祝说为致真之法，吐纳进退求登五辰之道，分书五通，使解罪咎之日，题之曰：八素真经太上之隐书也。 以付太虚真人南岳赤君，使下授学道，宿有真金玉字，刻在金阁，当为真人者，不得越传於地仙也。 有得太上八素隐书者，皆玄录着於紫宫，玉名刊于上清，当受命为真人，故得之也。 俗世之人，千万之中误有一人为天神所授，以得此经，或得而不行者，皆因缘传驿为上真之使耳。 子无疑焉，虽受而不行，故当为尸解之仙，但当不得作飞仙真人耳。 尸解之后，自复渐令涉高妙之涂，悟其迷网之心也。 但用年岁，是为小久而反真超迹矣。 子其勖哉，子其隐哉。 太虚真人受教而下告曰：此太上之灵文，登晨之妙道也。 七百年听三传。 上宰王君曰：百年之内，有二人可授，及得真灵之感应者，亦授之，要在七百年内，唯听三传而已。 皆清斋七日，乃付此经，受者亦然。 又当敌盟告誓，以启其心。 其受行五星致上真之道者，脆有经之师，白绢四十尺，银环二双。 受修五通之事者，脆有经之师，青布三十二尺，为终身切血不泄之约，不漏之信。 於是三官径奏天帝，天帝上请玉女，给受书者； 径奏上清，上清上请玉童，给侍八素之灵文也。 各三十二人，并司有书者之过，记有书者之功，勤纤芥毫厘，辄刺上宫。 其非人而授，限过而出，露言隐书，宣泄吉日，不奉盟誓，不信秘言，皆犯《四极明科》泄闭之罪，三祖、父母，获考三官，身为下鬼，挞蒙山之石，副诸五岳，汲冥海之水，灌诸四渎，身无仙冀，而七考地狱。 子於传授之际，修行之时，深当精慎，每为宝秘。 太上告李君殷勤者，恐其失道故也。 又此经上有五皇上真道君、君夫人之讳字，及五通之日，不宜令含生者知之，增为秘隐之烦重也。 后圣李君曰：子处俗在家，未修至道者，恐世上百邪、千妖百魔犯子神炁者，但以夜半时，向五方先闭气五过，各阴祝吾刻五岳石笥上文三过，从西岳白玉为简，余四岳又以书一通，始不得及白素之篇也，祝之三过。 三过祝毕，叩齿三十六下，除百邪，拘三魂，制七魄也。 此之祝说，非外舍之道经云云，此语无章句也，百邪、三魂、七魄亦不畏此矣。 夫道之妙秘，真玄绝众，外题犹能制百邪，检魂魄，况其石笥中所宝上者乎。 百鬼万精，千邪众妖，皆行走名山，为诸灵驱使，皆见一五岳李君石笥上刻题之文，但为不知笥内是何道之经文耳。 道士宜恒祝此刻文，诸鬼辈谓人当修笋内之经，故致畏惧，而不敢近也。 太虚真人口诀 太虚真人曰：先师见教，以五通日，日出三四丈许，正立，以心对日，存三魂神与日光俱入心中，良久，闭气三息，咽液三过，微祝曰： 太阳散辉，垂光紫青，来入我魂，照我五形，却鬼试心，使心平正，内彻九气，外通胎命，飞仙上清，玉箓已定。 祝毕，以手拭目二七，叩齿二七，都毕。 此法使人三魂凝明，丹心方正，万邪藏术，心试不行，真要道也，子当常行之。 诸以五通日，向日趣令嚏，若不得嚏，以软物向日引导鼻中，亦即嚏也，嚏即祝曰：

On the auspicious assembly of the *ren-chen* day, when the Sagely Lord descends, he shall command the summoning of the Five Marchmounts to bring forth these coffered scriptures, entrusting them to the Supreme Minister and the Four Assistants, that they may instruct those of the highest Perfected talent.

Another copy shall be inscribed upon white silk adorned with the eightfold radiance, written in self-generating script. The graded incantations and explanations shall be set forth as the method for attaining Perfection: the practices of exhalation and inhalation, advance and retreat, and the quest for the Way of Ascending the Five Celestial Bodies. Divided into five parts, it shall be titled for the days of absolving transgressions: *The Hidden Writ of the Supreme Lord, the Eightfold Simplicity Perfected Scripture.* It shall be entrusted to the Perfected of the Great Void, the Red Lord of the Southern Marchmount, to transmit below to those who study the Dao, who bear the characters of true gold and jade inscribed within the Golden Pavilion, and who are destined to become Perfected Ones. It must not be transmitted beyond to earthbound immortals.

Those who obtain *The Hidden Writ of the Supreme Lord in Eightfold Simplicity* shall have their names of mystery recorded in the Purple Palace and their jade appellations carved in the Upper Clarity. They shall receive the mandate to become Perfected Ones, and thus shall they obtain it. Among the common folk, in ten thousand times ten thousand, there may be one whom the celestial spirits deign to instruct, thereby obtaining this scripture. Some may receive it yet fail to practice it—all are but couriers of karmic transmission, destined to serve the Perfected Ones above. Have no doubt: even those who receive but do not practice shall become immortals through the corpse-liberation, though they shall not attain the rank of flying immortals or Perfected Ones. After corpse-liberation, they shall gradually traverse the path of the most wondrous, awakening from the delusions of their hearts. Though the years may pass, it is but a brief span before they return to the True and transcend their traces.

Strive on, child! Conceal yourself well!

The Perfected of the Great Void, having received the teaching, descended and proclaimed: "This is the numinous writ of the Supreme Lord, the wondrous Dao of Ascending the Dawn."

The Lord Minister Wang declared: "Within a hundred years, there may be two worthy of transmission. If one receives the resonance of the true numina, they too may be entrusted, but within seven hundred years, only three transmissions are permitted." All must purify themselves for seven days before bestowing this scripture; the recipient must do likewise. They shall further exchange vows and oaths to awaken their resolve.

For those who receive and practice the Way of the Five Stars to attain the Perfected Ones above, they shall offer their master of the scriptures forty feet of white silk and two pairs of silver rings. For those who undertake the cultivation of the Five Penetrations, they shall offer their master of the scriptures thirty-two feet of blue cloth, pledging a lifelong covenant sealed in blood, an unbroken vow of secrecy. Thereupon, the Three Offices shall directly memorialize the Celestial Emperor, who shall request the Jade Maidens to attend the recipient. They shall directly memorialize the Upper Clarity, which shall request the Jade Lads to serve the numinous writ of the *Eightfold Simplicity.* Each shall be attended by thirty-two, who shall record the transgressions and merits of the scripture’s keeper, noting even the slightest infraction to inscribe in the Upper Palace.

Should one who is unworthy receive it, or should it be transmitted beyond its allotted time, or should its hidden words be revealed, its auspicious days disclosed, or its oaths and secret pledges disregarded, all shall violate the *Bright Statutes of the Four Poles* and incur the crime of divulging sealed mysteries. Their three generations of ancestors and parents shall be examined by the Three Offices; their bodies shall become lowly ghosts, lashed with the stones of Mount Meng, bound to the Five Marchmounts, and made to draw the waters of the Dark Sea to irrigate the Four Waterways. Deprived of all hope for immortality, they shall endure the seven trials of the earthly prisons.

At the time of transmission and during the period of cultivation, you must be most meticulous and reverent, ever treasuring and guarding its secrecy. The Supreme Lord’s earnest admonition to Lord Li was precisely to prevent the loss of the Dao.

Moreover, this scripture bears the taboo names and characters of the Five August Perfected Lords of the Dao, the Lords’ Consorts, and the days of the Five Penetrations. These must not be disclosed to the living, lest they compound the burden of its secrecy.

The later Sagely Lord Li said: "If you dwell among the common folk and have not yet cultivated the utmost Dao, and should the hundred evils, thousand demons, and myriad specters assail your spirit and qi, at midnight face the Five Directions, hold your breath five times, and silently recite the inscription from the stone coffer of the Five Marchmounts three times. Begin with the Western Marchmount’s white jade tablets, then inscribe one copy each for the remaining four Marchmounts—though not extending to the white silk chapters—and recite them three times. Upon completing the three recitations, knock your teeth together thirty-six times to dispel the hundred evils, restrain the three hun-souls, and subdue the seven po-souls.

This incantation is not found in the exoteric scriptures of the Dao; it has no fixed verses. Yet the hundred evils, the three hun, and the seven po shall have no fear of it. If the outer titles alone can restrain the hundred evils and regulate the hun and po, how much more potent are the treasures sealed within the stone coffers?

The myriad ghosts and spirits, the thousand evils and myriad demons, all roam the famous mountains, driven as servants by the various numina. Yet upon seeing the inscribed title of the Five Marchmounts’ Lord Li on the stone coffer, they flee in terror, ignorant of what scripture lies within. Daoists should regularly recite this inscribed text, for the ghosts and spirits shall assume one is practicing the scripture within the coffer and thus dare not approach."

**Oral Instructions of the Perfected of the Great Void**

The Perfected of the Great Void said: "My former master taught that on the days of the Five Penetrations, when the sun has risen three or four *zhang*, stand upright and face it with your heart. Visualize the three hun-souls and the sunlight entering your heart together. After a long while, hold your breath for three breaths, swallow your saliva three times, and softly recite:

*‘The radiance of the Great Yang scatters its light,
Purple and azure rays descend.
Enter my hun-souls,
Illumine my fivefold form.
Repel the testing ghosts,
Set my heart aright.
Within, penetrate the nine qi;
Without, connect to the embryo’s destiny.
Fly as an immortal to the Upper Clarity,
The jade register is already fixed.’*

Upon completing the recitation, wipe your eyes fourteen times and knock your teeth fourteen times. This practice shall cause the three hun-souls to congeal and brighten, the cinnabar heart to become upright and true. All the arts of the myriad evils shall be rendered powerless, and the testing of the heart shall cease. This is the essential Dao—practice it constantly.

On the days of the Five Penetrations, face the sun and induce sneezing. If sneezing does not come, use a soft object to gently stimulate the nose while facing the sun, and sneezing shall follow. Upon sneezing, recite..."

chunks.original_text: 天光来进，六胎上通，三魂守神，七魄不亡，承日呜嚏，与日同光，飞仙上清，位为真公。 祝毕，拭目二十七。 是内精上交日光，三魂发明於内，使人心开神解，百精流转於内府也。 若非五通日，可不须尔也。 又春乙卯日、夏丙午日、秋庚申日、冬壬子日，冥卧时，先捣朱砂、雄黄、雌黄三物，分等细捣之，以绵裹之，使如枣大。 临卧时，以塞两耳中，此消三尸、炼七魄之道，秘法也。 勿令有知者矣。 明日日中时，以东流水洗浴，毕，更饰床席，易着衣服浣故者，更着履而洗澡之，却又洒扫於所寝床下，通令所住一室盛洁也。 更安枕，卧向上，闭气握固，良久，而微祝曰： 天道有常，改易故新，上帝吉日，沐浴为真，三气消尸，朱黄安魂，宝炼七魄，与我相亲。 祝毕。 此道是消炼尸秽之上法，改易新形之要诀也。 四时唯各取一日为之耳。 受经布，每令精上玉童、玉女，皆察看取与处所，审心诀之根，尽与不尽也。 子当识此处意旨矣。 受者慎无私散，以营饥寒。

The six embryos ascend and connect above,
The three hun-souls guard the spirit,
The seven po-souls do not perish.
Receive the sun’s sneeze and chant,
Sharing its light with the sun.
Fly as an immortal to the Upper Clarity,
Attain the rank of Perfected Lord.

Upon completing the recitation, wipe your eyes twenty-seven times. This causes the inner essence to rise and merge with the sunlight, the three hun-souls to shine forth within, opening the heart and liberating the spirit, while the hundred essences flow and circulate through the inner palace. If it is not one of the Five Penetration days, this need not be done.

Moreover, on the days of *yǐ-mǎo* in spring, *bǐng-wǔ* in summer, *gēng-shēn* in autumn, and *rén-zǐ* in winter, at the time of retiring in darkness, first grind cinnabar, realgar, and orpiment in equal parts until fine, then wrap them in silk to form a ball the size of a jujube. At bedtime, insert these into both ears. This is the Dao of dispelling the Three Corpses and refining the seven po-souls—a secret method. Let no one else know of it.

The next day at noon, bathe in east-flowing water. Afterward, renew the bedding and mat, change into freshly laundered clothes, replace your shoes, and wash them as well. Then sweep and purify the area beneath the bed where you sleep, ensuring the entire chamber is immaculate. Reset the pillow, lie facing upward, hold your breath, and clench your fists. After a long while, softly recite:

The Dao of Heaven is constant,
Transforming the old to make it new.
On this auspicious day of the Highest Emperor,
I bathe to become true.
The Three Qi dispel the corpse,
Cinnabar and yellow stabilize the soul.
The precious refinement of the seven po-souls
Draws them near to me.

Upon completing the recitation—this is the supreme method for dispelling corpse impurities and renewing the form, the essential formula for transformation. Perform it once in each of the four seasons.
